p: Arthralgia was reported only in the TFR phase ( Online Supplementary Table S2). Eleven patients reported musculoskeletal pain events during the early phase of the TFR; these events were categorized as TKI withdrawal syndrome. The characteristics of the patients with TKI withdrawal syndrome are described in Table 5. The median time of onset of the TKI withdrawal syndrome in the TFR phase was 1 month (range, 0â€“6). All patients recovered completely with or without treatment. Of the 11 patients with the syndrome, eight (73%) maintained TFR at 12 months and remained in remission throughout the 36-month follow-up period. There were no significant differences in the TFR survival curves between subgroups based on TKI withdrawal syndrome.
